column3: Strategy index inside actor $g$ (1 = high-commitment, 2 = medium, 3 = low)

“Delta-effect”: estimated change in the headline metric if this strategy is used **one unit more**.
(Negative values *improve* the situation; positive values worsen it.)
Private cost to the actor when it adopts strategy $k$ (money, staff time, political risk …)
Weight in $[0,1]$ expressing how strongly actor $g$ values an improvement in the headline metric
Tiny floor constant (e.g. $10^{-3}$) to keep pay-offs strictly positive
**Pay-off**: the net “reward” actor $g$ expects from strategy $k$ at epoch $t$
